metadata.title: Sony ZV-E10 vs Canon M50 2025: Best YouTube Camera
metadata.description: Compare Sony ZV-E10 and Canon M50 for YouTube. Video features, autofocus, and value.

hero.headline: Sony ZV-E10 vs Canon M50
hero.subheadline: Two popular vlogging cameras. Which delivers better YouTube video?

sections.content: The Sony ZV-E10 was designed specifically for creators. The Canon M50 is a popular hybrid option. Both shoot great video in their price range, but they approach vlogging differently. Here's how they compare for YouTube content.

content.title: Creator-Focused
content.description: Product showcase mode, background defocus button. Built for content.

content.title: Built-in Mic
content.description: Directional 3-capsule mic. Decent audio out of box.

content.title: Real-Time Eye AF
content.description: Locks on face/eyes reliably. Walk-and-talk friendly.

content.title: Stills Capability
content.description: Better hybrid photo/video. More versatile overall.

content.title: EF-M Lens Selection
content.description: Compact lenses, plus EF adapter option. Flexible system.

content.title: Learning Resources
content.description: Massive community, tutorials everywhere. Great for beginners.

faq.question: Which has better autofocus?
faq.answer: ZV-E10 has superior video autofocus with real-time eye tracking. M50's Dual Pixel is good but not as sticky in video mode.

faq.question: Is the 4K crop on M50 a problem?
faq.answer: Yes, significant crop makes 4K less useful. Most M50 users shoot 1080p. ZV-E10's 4K has smaller crop.

faq.question: Which is better for beginners?
faq.answer: M50 is more beginner-friendly with more learning resources. ZV-E10 is simple too but more video-focused.

faq.question: Audio quality difference?
faq.answer: ZV-E10's built-in mic is better. Both support external micsâ€”use one for best results regardless.
